markdownRemark.html:
The fab Edinburgh Hoppers kindly invited me to give a keynote at their annual Ada Lovelace Day conference. Iâ€™ve pulled together references and follow up resources for that talk here.

References ðŸ“š

  • Ada Lovelace: Victorian computing visionary - Charman-Anderson
  • Ada Lovelace Institute
  • Examining the Black Box: Tools for Assessing Algorithmic Systems - Ada Lovelace Institute and DataKind UK, 2020
  • Gender Shades - Buolamwini et al., 2018
  • Actionable Auditing: Investigating the Impact of Publicly Naming Biased Performance Results of Commercial AI Products - Raji & Buolamwini, 2019
  • Saving Face: Investigating the Ethical Concerns of Facial Recognition Auditing - Raji et al., 2020
  • UK passport photo checker shows bias against dark-skinned women - Ahmed, 2020
  • Towards fairer datasets: filtering and balancing the distribution of the people subtree in the ImageNet hierarchy - Yang et al., 2020
  • Garbage in, garbage out?: do machine learning application papers in social computing report where human-labeled training data comes from? - Geiger et al., 2020
  • Source of ImageNet graphic used in slides
  • Machine Bias, in ProPublica - Angwin et al., 2016
  • How We Analyzed the COMPAS Recidivism Algorithm - Larson et al., 2016
  • Studying up: reorienting the study of algorithmic fairness around issues of power - Barabas et al., 2020
  • The State of Data Center Energy Use in 2018 - Johnson & Currie, 2018
  • Sustainable Servers by 2024 petition
  • Green AI - Schwartz et al., 2019
  • ClimateAction.Tech community
  • Doing Good Better - Will MacAskill

Resources âœ¨

  • DataKind UK Data Ethics Bookclub - now online, but used to be in person in Edinburgh too!
  • Toward ethical, transparent and fair AI/ML: a critical reading list

  • Introductory books:

    • Weapons of Math Destruction - Cathy Oâ€™Neill
    • Automating Inequality - Virginia Eubanks
